page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Bellingham used to have a castle which existed in the twelfth century.De Bellinghams lived in the {castle.}All that is left is a green mound near the Hareshaw Burn. In later years the border areas of England and Scotland were quite dangerous places to live. There were many family feuds with parties if raiders or{reivers}as they were known going out to steal and plunder other peoples property and livestock. Farmhouses were made with strong walls and slits to spy or shoot through. At the Hole farm there is a good example of a{fortified farmhouse}or {bastle.}Some changes have been made but you can see where the family lived upstairs with the animals below.The hole for climbing through can still be seen. The farmer uses the lower part of the building for cattle.
